feat.value: An anchoritic monk was wandering in the desert,
and he said to himself,
'I have kept straight in virtue.'
And he prayed to God, saying,
'Provide whatever I need.'
God wished to make his thoughts humble.
He said to him, 'Go to this particular archimandrite,
and do whatever he tells you.'
And God revealed this to the archimandrite, saying,
'Behold, this particular anchorite is coming to you.
Give him a whip and make him tend the pigs.'
And the monk came and knocked on the door,
and he went to the head of the congregation.
They embraced each other and they sat down.
And the anchorite said,
'What should I do so that I may be saved?'
The archimandrite said to him,
'You will do what I tell you.'
And he said yes, and he said to him,
'Take this whip and tend the pigs.'
And those who know him saw him tending the pigs.
And they were saying, 'Look at this great anchorite, whose heart is deranged,
and there is a demon in him,
since he tends the pigs.'
And God saw his humility,
that he was patient with the insults of the men in this way.
He sent him back to his cell.
